title: Keen mentioned in g4tv.com interview. Source code mentioned
content:
Just watched a repeat of G4tv.com. A show on G4 thats basicly like an interactive show where viewers can call in and ask questions and voice their opinions on games and stuff. In last weeks episode they had some of the guys from ID software come up and talk about their latest work like Quake 4, The doom movie and their upcoming new wolfinstine game. When one of the questions that was asked by a fan was concerning whether Commander Keen would make a comeback they basicly responded that he's probably not coming back since the doom guy killed him in doom 2 (damn you easter eggs! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:"> ). But the important thing was that Carmack mentioned that he did want to release the source code like their previous games but was unable to find them and acknowloges that there are alot of Keen fans out there. Well at least they are noticing us [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]
Check out my fanfics at [url=http://www.fanfiction.net/u/680124/]fanfiction.net[/url]

title: Re: Keen mentioned in g4tv.com interview. Source code mentio
content:
Me see that too!

About damn time we get a mention! Stupid doom, ID are IDiots! Hopefully Carmack and Hall can get together and figure something out. Maybe we have three IDers on our side?

A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Mod2.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Keen mentioned in g4tv.com interview. Source code mentio
content:
You're talking about [url=http://www.g4tv.com/xplay/]X-Play[/url] right?
I happened to visit their site just yesterday.

Although I've never seen the show, for some reason I've seen it mentioned numerous times, mostly through Unreal-related sites, probably among other reasons because of one of the hosts, Morgan Webb.

Thanks for the update, anyway!
I'm glad to hear Carmack wants to release the source code, less glad he managed to misplace it, apparently.
Maybe I have my priorities wrong, but I'd personally much rather see them get rid of the right to the Keen character and games, as in, give them to Tom Hall, or sell them for a nice price.
Apparently they're not going to do anything with it anymore... I don't think the GBA game sold particularly well, not helping them wanting to keep the rights either.
At least that way we should see some new, official, Tom Hall, Keen games.

Of course some good programmers fooling around with the source code to enhance those games isn't too bad either; I like playing Doom, DN3D, and SW on my relatively new computer with OpenGL and everything as well.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

content:
I now dislike Carmack a bit less. There's hope for Keen Hacking yet.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

title: heheh
content:
"A bit less," eh? :-) The man's a progressive thinker, almost to a fault. I suspect he's not got an ounce of nostalgia in his body--which is probably why none of us can quite understand him. I'm still extraordinarily grateful for his making Keen a possibility.

Besides, wasn't Adrian the one who didn't like Keen?

title: Re: Wow!
content:
I probably would never figure out what to do with the source code. I don't even know what programming language Keen is written in![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] (and opening the Commander Keen files with MsDOS edit opens the files in ASCII, which is a problem, because the weird symbols ASCII don't make any sense to me.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] )Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
"I always try to consume interesting animals."-LevelLord

title: Re: Wow!
content:
Harvey, the CK files as they are in the games are compiled.
This means "rewritten" so that computers can read them.
The ASCII characters aren't even what the computer is seeing, it is an interpretation by DOS's Edit.
Before that happened, there was the source code, which is more or less readable, depending on how well you understand the language used.
Once the source code is compiled with the relevant compiler, the language doesn't matter anymore; it is now unreadable.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
